meta.notes: Stage 1.1 templates: phonemes, glyph radicals, meanings, grammar options, room & artifact templates, story templates, and a few generator hints.

grammar_options.name: SOV-suffixing
grammar_options.notes: Subjects before objects; case/tense expressed with suffixes.

grammar_options.name: SVO-prefixing
grammar_options.notes: More isolating; order carries more meaning than morphology.

grammar_options.name: VSO-mixed
grammar_options.notes: Verb-initial; single affixes may encode multiple features.

room_templates: A vast, silent chamber. A crumbling [altar] stands in the center; strange glyphs cover the northern wall.
A narrow archive corridor lined with cracked [shelves] and scattered clay tablets.
A domed hall with a collapsed skylight. Faded murals depict [rituals] beneath looping glyph bands.
A flooded archive: shallow water laps at stone [pedestals] with floating seals and tablets.
A cramped workshop cluttered with rusted [machines] and fragments of inscribed plates.
An observatory with a broken lens and a mosaic floor showing constellations and unknown [stars].
A sealed vault chamber. A heavy stone [door] is scored with repeated glyphs and a single central sigil.
A quiet shrine alcove where offerings of polished stones sit before a carved [idol] marked with delicate glyph lines.

artifact_templates.notes: Good for pictorial pairing: image shows an object and an action — inscription mirrors order.
Short functionary label; often used for ritual labels or item tags.
Narrative artwork with longer inscriptions; good for repeated tokens.
Short symbolic token — high frequency but low single-clue value.
Longer multi-sentence inscriptions; can include first-person accounts or propaganda.
Often names people/roles; useful for building faction & leader vocab.
